reviews.review_msg: Dr. Han is a fantastic prof, i had her for Ling322 but for some reason that wasnt an option when making this review, she is a bit intimidating in class but super friendly and accessible in office hours, she genuinly cares for her students and explains things in very comprehensive and clear ways. Highy highly reccomend.

she's one of the nicest profs ive had at sfu. the contents of ling 324 were quite heavy but she made them clear and easy to understand. attendance is optional, meaning shes not taking attendance marks, but you'd understand nothing if you skip the class and just read textbooks/slides. her assignments are not easy but directly related to the exams

There are a LOT of weekly readings. The weekly "pre-quizzes" aren't too bad since you get 2+ attempts. Every bi-weekly assignment must be done in groups, so it's difficult to coordinate. Weekly Zoom lectures barely cover the material since group presentations take up most of the time. She's nice during office hours and answers questions in depth.

Nancy is the sweetest lady you will ever meet! However, she uses VERY technical language and abstract definitions of concepts and has trouble coming up with additional examples. Exams were easy though, just the assignments with a few words changed.

Sweet lady, and very understanding if you need to discuss anything related to the class.  Her lectures are ridiculously boring, and the notes are available online.  Exams were fair, and she preps you pretty well for them.
She is a nice and helpful prof, but from time to time, she might be unsure about some questions.  Ling 324 is easy if you taken some logic courses.
Nancy is a very nice and very smart lady. Her tests are fair, really close to what was done in class. The only thing is that if no one asks questions, she lectures on pretty much like a robot.
Her lecture is boring, but her midterms are fairly easy.  She is a nice prof.
She's a very nice lady, but her lectures are not too interesting, her course is very difficult and she doesn't explain very well.  But she's helpful during office hours.

John is a great prof who really cares for his students and always makes sure we understand the material. This class was difficult because of the content, but he checks in and provides lots of practice. He replies to emails fast and provides an extra credit quiz at the end of the sem. For a class I found very hard, John helped make it doable!

Trevor is fantastic in education. He knows how to make stuff easier to understand. He genuinely wants you to do well and makes things fair for students. He gives you a strong foundation in the logic needed for linguistics. I didn't know Syntax and I still found those bits of the course easy to understand because he explained clearly.

I LOVE TREVOR. HE IS THE MOST UNDERSTANDING AND ACCOMMODATING PERSON I'VE EVER MET. He explains the material very well and connects with everyone on a personal and professional level. While the material is incredibly tough for a linguistics course, Trevor makes it doable and I don't dread attending his lectures!
The course is intimidating at first but its not as bad as it seems. Its easy to do well if you go to class, do the homework and ask Trevor questions. He is really sweet and very patient.

This class is not what I expected AT ALL. There is A LOT OF math even though this is a linguistics course but Trevor is very clear and makes it seem easy. The first exam average was 89% and it was all math!!!!!!! He is very patient and will write a big email if I have a question. I really like this class.
